dict.acceptation: 到…之上；对…了解；[数]映射到…上；

sent.orig: Suddenly she climbs back onto the Titanic scrambling onto the deck below Cal and Jack.
sent.trans: 突然，她爬回泰坦尼克号，从卡尔和杰克脚下的甲板跌跌撞撞地爬上船。

sent.orig: A tree fell onto her cottage and onto the other.
sent.trans: 一棵树倒在她的别墅的屋顶上，落在床铺。

sent.orig: A tree fell onto her house and onto the other half of the bed.
sent.trans: 一棵树砸坏了，并砸在床的另一边上了。

sent.orig: He a new generation coming onto the world stage, onto the American stage.
sent.trans: 他代表步入世界舞台和美国舞台的新一代人。

sent.orig: Gently pour bonito sauce onto the plate without splashing onto tofu.
sent.trans: 将日本鲣鱼汁倒入碟子里。
